q13.question: How did Edmond ingratiate himself to the Mondegos?
q13.answer: ['by staging the kidnap and rescue of their son']
q13.recall: Edmond's fortunes peaked when Morel named him captain of one of his ships and he proposed to Mercedes, who accepted the offer. This was during the turbulent days in which France was transitioning away from Napoleonic rule, and Edmond and his closest friend, Fernand Mondego, aspired to gain the same two things: the next captaincy of a ship in Morel's Marseille-based shipping business and the hands of the lovely Mercedes Iguanada.
q13.vectordb: Edmond ingratiated himself to the Mondegos by aspiring to gain the same two things as Fernand Mondego: the next captaincy of a ship in Morel's Marseille-based shipping business and the hands of the lovely Mercedes Iguanada. However, Fernand later betrayed Edmond by making the magistrate Villefort aware of the letter that Edmond was carrying, which led to Edmond's arrest and imprisonment.
q13.hybrid: Edmond ingratiated himself to the Mondegos by aspiring to gain the same two things as Fernand Mondego: the next captaincy of a ship in Morel's Marseille-based shipping business and the hands of the lovely Mercedes Iguanada. However, Fernand later betrayed Edmond by making the magistrate Villefort aware of the letter that Edmond was carrying, which led to Edmond's arrest and imprisonment.
